The member is in a common law marriage from which she has two children. She still works in a shopping center in the town of Cusco. She continues to sell pastries and desserts such as pies, cakes, jello, flan and pudding. Aside from that, she's an enterprising woman who also sells CDs and DVDs. On this occasion the member requests the loan in order to purchase merchandise such as music CDs and movie DVDs.
The member gives thanks for the loan and pledges to make her repayments according to the payment schedule.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as music CDs and movie DVDs.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en: As a hardworking mother, Nena aimed to strengthen her hog-raising business to earn sufficient income for her family. She is now 44 years old and has seven children. Nena and her husband plan to continue sending their children to school so that they will earn degrees and become professionals someday. In this regard, Nena is asking for additional capital of PHP 30,000.00 to buy feeds, vitamins, and piglets to raise. She says that this loan will enable her to improve the business and she hopes that she will be successful someday as she continues to work hard and strive harder.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and piglets to raise.

loans.name: Kathy

texts.en:
Kathy is 32 years old and lives in Sumasap, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married but has no children. 
To earn a living, Kathy has a business selling flowers. She earns about PHP 2,000 each month doing this type of work. Kathy has requested loan of PHP 5,000  to be used in the purchase of more flower seedlings, sprays, and fertilizers for her gardening.
Kathy has been a member of PMPC just this year. In the future, Kathy hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to be used in the purchase of more flower seedlings, sprays, and fertilizers.

loans.name: Nelsie

texts.en:
Nelsie is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. Nelsie sells dressed chicken. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more dressed chicken to re-sell.
Nelsie is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Nelsie hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy more dressed chicken to re-sell

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en: This time, Jessie is borrowing PHP 30,000 to fund her fish vending business. This business was previously funded through NWTF and KIVA partner. It continues to provide Jessie and her family with income that is improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell at her food stall.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is married with eight children. She is 58 years old and lives in Goin, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

Juliana has owned a general store to earn a living and had this business for three years. Each month, she earns PHP 4,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for PHP 25,000 to purchase more stock for her general store.

Juliana has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Juliana hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es: Vicente vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y maicillo, tiene varios años de trabajar en el rubro de la agricultura eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener siempre las mejores cosechas, el terreno de cultivo se ubica en una zona de alta incidencia agrícola y está cercano a su residencia, comercia en todas las zonas cercanas a la localidad y tiene mucha clientela pues las personas saben que todo lo que vende es de primera calidad y  a precios bajos  además el servicio es inigualable siempre a la orden de los clientes; Vicente es un hombre muy responsable, honesto y muy humilde, siempre esta a la expectativa de nuevas oportunidades pues sabe que solo así lograra el triunfo; Vicente es un hombre motivado y muy trabajador le gusta esforzarse porque sabe que es el secreto del éxito, en la ultima siembra debido al clima tuvo muchas perdidas por eso en esta temporada de cosecha tiene la disposición de aumentar la producción pero necesita de capital que respalde la compra de insumos por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, maicillo, herbicida, abono, etc. Vicente tiene buenas referencias de pago y asegura que podrá cancelar la deuda y al mismo tiempo ofrecerle a su familia seguridad económica.
texts.en: Vicente lives with his life partner and their children. He grows corn and sorghum. He has worked in agriculture for years, and this has given him a lot of experience that always allows him to obtain the best harvests. The land he farms is in an area with a lot of agricultural activity and is close to his residence. He sells in all the areas near his town, and he has a lot of customers, since people know that everything he sells is of the highest quality and at low prices. Additionally, the service is unequalled, and he is always at his customers' disposal. Vicente is a very responsible, honest, and humble man. He is always awaiting new opportunities since he knows that that is the only way he will succeed. Vicente is a motivated and very hard-working man. He likes to work hard because he knows it is the secret of success. In the last planting he had a lot of losses due to the weather, so this harvest season he wants to increase his production. However, he needs capital to back the purchase of supplies, so he is asking INTEGRAL for a loan that allows him to buy corn seed, sorghum, herbicide, manure, etc. Vicente has good payment references and he promises that he will be able to pay back the debt and at the same time offer his family financial security.

loans.use: to buy corn seed, sorghum, herbicide, and manure

loans.name: Rosefel

texts.en: Rosefel is from Sepac, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 34 years old. Rosefel is married and has 1 child. To make a living, she raises coconuts and durian to sell. She has been in business for 3 years and earns PHP 10,000 a month from these activities. In 2011, Rosefel joined GDMPC. Rosefel is requesting a loan of PHP 18,000 which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Alva

texts.es:
Alva tiene 40 años, es una mujer alegre y con muchos deseos de superación, además de ser amable y cordial. Su pareja es Alexander, el padre de sus tres hijos: Nilda de 16, Patrik de 8 y Belén de 4 años. Juntos viven en su casa propia, la cual construyó con mucho esfuerzo.

La actividad que ella realiza es la confección de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, oficio que aprendió estudiando en un centro de educación ocupacional. Empezó hace un año, comprando una máquina de coser con sus ahorros, la cual instaló en su vivienda, donde también atiende a sus clientes. Le gusta su oficio, pues le brinda las ganancias que le sirven para apoyar a su pareja en solventar los gastos de su hogar. Pero comenta que lo le incomoda es el cansancio de estar sentada en una misma postura, le ocasiona dolores de espalda, pero eso no la desanima y continua trabajando y esforzándose. 

Este es su préstamo número 10 con la institución MFP y se siente contenta de poder contar con un capital de trabajo gracias para poder entregar los pedidos que tiene pendientes. Además, está a gusto con su banco comunal, por considerarlo un grupo unido y colaborador.
De los 2000 nuevos soles que ahora solicita, invertirá 380 en la compra de una máquina remalladora que sirve para estampar broches y botones; con el saldo comprará materiales de costura como telas, hilos y demás.
texts.en: Alva is 40 years old and is a polite, cheerful and friendly woman who is highly motivated to succeed. She has three children with her common-law husband Alexander. Her children are Nilda, who is 16, Patrik, who is 8, and Belén, who is 4. They live together in their own home, which they built with a great deal of effort. She has a business making clothing for men, women and children. She learned this trade from an occupational school. She started a year ago, buying a sewing machine with her savings. She installed the machine at her home, where she also attends to her clients. She likes her job, because it brings her earnings which help her to support her husband in meeting the household expenses. But she reports that at times it becomes very uncomfortable to be sitting in the same position for long periods of time, and she has occasional back pains. However, this does not deter her, and she continues to work and make an effort. This is her 10th loan with MFP, and she is grateful to have access to this working capital so that she will be able to fulfill the orders that she currently has pending. Furthermore, she enjoys being part of her communal bank, since she considers them to be a united group whose members help each other. Of the 2000 nuevos soles she is seeking, she will invest in a mending machine that will allow her to attach brooches and buttons. With the remaining funds she will buy sewing supplies, such as thread, needles and other items.

loans.use: to buy a mending machine.  With the remaining funds she will buy sewing supplies, such as thread and needles.

loans.name: Pedro Pablo

texts.es:
Pedro Pablo tiene 60 años, Es soltero vive solo tiene dos hijos pero son casados y no viven con el, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos..

Los miembros de la V.R.C. LUCHANDO POR UNA MISMA CAUSA, se encuentra ubicada en el en el Recinto La primavera, perteneciente al Canton Ventans, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz.

Pedro Pablo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz  y frejol. Las compras de los productos lo hace en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de insumos y fertilizantes para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito podra comprar los productos sin ningún tipo de problema. El sueño es tener mas terreno para sembrar cacao.

En el tiempo libre le gusta visitar a los familiares y escuchar música.
texts.en:
Pedro Pablo, 60, is single and lives alone in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.  He has two children but they are married and don’t live with him.

The members of the “Luchando por Una Misma Causa” (Fighting for the Same Cause) communal bank are located in Recinto La Primavera that belongs to Ventanas Canton; it’s involved with short term corn and rice farming.

Pedro Pablo is a corn, rice and broad bean farmer.  He buys his products in Ventanas.  He’s requesting the loan to plant corn and rice, to buy supplies and fertilizers for the crops.  With support from the loan he will be able to buy the products problem-free.  His dream is to have more land to plant cocoa beans.  In his free time he enjoys visiting family and listening to music.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Mahmadrasul

texts.en:
Mahmadrasul is married and has 2 children for whom he has always wanted to provide a good quality of life. It is for this reason that he began his own driving four years ago. He serves local people, transporting them from one place to another with his car. Thanks to the good service he provides, he has managed to gain many customers. Since he’s had his business, his family’s quality of life has been improving. Now his children are able to get a good education and his financial challenges are being solved little by little. His wife is a seamstress and sews very wonderful dresses for women. In this way, she helps her husband improve the family's living conditions. He is asking for a loan of 1500 TJS to repair his car. 
In this way, he will have the opportunity to provide better service and to increase his income which will allow him to offer his children and wife a better quality of life and better financial opportunities for getting ahead.

loans.use: to repair his car.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 46 years old, married to Solomon, and blessed with three children who are 20, 16 and 6, respectively. She owns a retail shop, rental houses, and a beauty salon. She started the retail shop 12 years ago and earns her a monthly income of KES 20,000.

She has requested a second loan of KES 80,000 to purchase crates of sodas, bales of maize and wheat flour, juices, pampers, and biscuits to sell. 

The profit she earns will be ploughed back into the business. Her dream is to open multiple businesses and be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase crates of sodas, bales of maize and wheat flour, juices, pampers and biscuits.

loans.name: Chay's Group

texts.en: Chay, 58, is a married mother. Her family lives in a thatched house located in the Sa Ang district of Kandal province, Cambodia. Chay and her husband have been working for others for a fee for eleven years to earn a living. Together, they can earn approximately 20,000 KHR per day to meet family’s needs. This is the first loan for Chay with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, while the other group member has been with VisionFund for three cycles. Chay is leading the group of two to request a loan with VisionFund. She is going to use her portion to buy materials for building a proper toilet, which includes brick, clay, a tile roof, and a latrine slab. She hopes that her family will have good health, so she can focus on her income-generating activities to improve the lifestyle of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for building a proper toilet.

loans.name: Roberto Antonio

texts.es: Roberto Antonio de veintiséis años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus  dos hijos; él se dedica al cultivo de cereales maíz, frijol, maicillo, tiene muchos años de trabajar en el rubro dela agricultura y se ha hecho de experiencia muy valiosa que le permite obtener muy buenas cosechas, el terreno de cultivo se ubica en una zona de alta incidencia agrícola, comercia en todas las zonas cercanas a la localidad y tiene mucha clientela pues las personas la prefieren  porque están seguros que todo lo que vende es de primera calidad y a precios bajos  además el servicio es único siempre a la disposición del cliente; Roberto es un hombre dedicado a su labor, entusiasta y muy  responsable quiere alcanzar el éxito y sabe que lo lograra si pone todo su esfuerzo y amor  al trabajo, en la ultima cosecha no alcanzo todas sus expectativas por eso en esta temporada de siembra quiere aumentar la producción y necesita comprar insumos por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, frijol, maicillo, abono, insecticida, etc. Roberto Antonio tiene buenas referencias crediticias y tiene la seguridad que cancelara su deuda en el periodo establecido y a la vez podrá darle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en: Roberto Antonio is 26 years old. He lives with his life partner and their two children. He grows cereals such as corn, beans and sorghum. He has been working in agriculture for many years and has accumulated very valuable experience, which allows him to obtain very good crops. The plot of land where he sows is located in a highly agricultural area. He makes his sales in all the neighboring areas and he has a lot of customers. People prefer to buy from him because they're certain that everything he sells is high quality at low prices, and also the service is one of a kind, always at his customers' disposal. Roberto is a man who's dedicated to his work, enthusiastic and very responsible. He wants to succeed and knows that he'll achieve that if he puts all of his efforts and love into his work. The last crop didn't meet all of his expectations, and that's why on this sowing season he wants to increase production and needs to buy supplies. For that reason he requests a loan from INTEGRAL which allows him to purchase corn, bean and sorghum seeds, compost, insecticide, etc. Roberto Antonio has a good credit record and he's sure that he'll repay his debt within schedule, and at the same time he'll be able to provide his family with a full life.

loans.use: to purchase corn, bean and sorghum seeds, compost and insecticide.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: Pedro de cincuenta y uno años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida, él se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de maíz y jocote, tiene muchos años de trabajar en este ámbito y se siente muy orgulloso de toda la experiencia ganada, porque sabe que eso le ayuda a obtener las mejores cosechas y por supuesto las mejores ganancias, el terreno de cultivo se encuentra ubicado en una zona favorable para la siembra y esta muy cerca de su residencia, comercia en todas las zonas aledañas a su localidad ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas saben que todo lo que comercia es de primera calidad y a precios muy accesibles, además el servicio es rápido y eficiente; Pedro es un hombre entregado a su trabajo dispuesto a salir adelante y demostrarse que puede alcanzar el éxito, en la ultima cosecha no logro sembrar lo suficiente por  eso no obtuvo los resultados esperados, quiere aumentar la producción y recuperarse pero necesita insumos por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz y jocote, herbicida, abono, etc. Pedro tiene buenas referencias de pago y asegura cancelar el crédito y a la vez darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Pedro, 51, lives with his life companion.  He works in agriculture, especially growing corn and jocote [a tropical fruit].  He has many years’ experience in this line of work and he feels very proud of the experience he’s acquired because he knows that it helps him attain better harvests and, of course, higher profits.  His field is located in an area that’s favorable for planting and is very near his house.  He sells in all the neighboring areas since he has many customers because people know that everything he sells is top quality at affordable prices.  Besides, service is fast and efficient.

Pedro is a man who is devoted to his work and willing to get ahead and show that he’s capable of attaining success.  He wasn’t able to plant enough in the previous season so his results weren’t what he expected.  He wants to increase production and recuperate but needs supplies which is why he’s asked INTEGRAL for a loan to buy corn and jocote seeds, herbicide, manure, etc.  Pedro has good payment references and he is sure that he will repay the loan while at the same time giving his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farm supplies.

loans.name: Los Claveles Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Noemi, tiene 58 años de edad, tiene 4 hijos mayores quienes son su apoyo en cada proyecto que ella emprende. Ella forma parte del grupo "Los Claveles", grupo que ha recibido su segundo crédito demostrando puntualidad en sus pagos.
Desde hace dos años la Sra. Noemi inició su negocio de crianza de animales de corral como cuyes, patos, pollos y gallinas.Inició con poquitos animales y poco a poco gracias a sus cuidados sus animalitos han ido aumentando, hoy en día ella tiene un negocio productivo con la venta de sus animalitos.
El prestamo recibido lo invertirá en la compra de alimento y medicinas para el cuidado de sus animales.
En la fotografía ubicaremos a la Sra. Noemi al centro vistiendo un saco negro.
texts.en: Noemí, 58, has four adult children who support all her efforts in every project she undertakes.  She’s part of the “Los Claveles” (Carnations) group which is receiving its second loan having been punctual with their payments.  She will use the received loan to buy animal feed and medicines to care for her animals.  In the photo, we can find Noemí in the center wearing a black coat.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Tayyar

texts.en:
Tayyar is a 46-year-old married man. He lives with his wife and six children in Jib Jennine. Tayyar has worked in agriculture for 17 years. In 2005, he started working himself. In order to improve his living, he plants wheat, potatoes, and vegetables.
Tayyar is working on improving and developing his business, and he is very proud with what he has.
He is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to buy a pick-up truck, which is necessary for transporting his products to wholesale markets and retail vegetable stores.
This is his fourth cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower, with a good history of repaying his loans. His previous loans helped a lot in increasing his income and improving his family's social and financial situations.
At the beginning, Tayyar had financial problems but he managed to work in an organized way which led to a visible improvement.
He hopes to keep on providing his children a healthy living and good education. He wants to see them become important people in the community.
Tayyar plans to buy new updated agricultural tools to improve his business production.

loans.use: to buy a pick-up truck.

loans.name: Beathe

texts.en: Beathe is 29 years old. She sells fruits and has been in this business for 12 years. With the loan requested, she will buy more fruits such as tree tomatoes, passion fruit, and mangoes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to build a house. She would like to see her business grow in the future so she can become a distributor.

loans.use: to buy more fruit such as tree tomatoes, passion fruit, and mangoes to sell.

loans.name: Nadzuwa

texts.en:
Nadzuwa, 25, is a hardworking and resolute woman with a strong desire to advance in life. Her partner is Ali, the father of her single child.
She sells consumer products in a retail shop. She buys the products from a nearby town and her main customers are her relatives and friends. She has achieved good results. Nadzuwa has been doing this since last year, working always on her own. What she likes about her business is that she can manage her spare time and invest it in her young child, whom she loves dearly, and who is her inspiration to move forward. Nadzuwa also likes to have an income to support her partner with household expenses.
This is her second loan with Yehu. She is thankful for the opportunity to have a credit line to help her expand her business. 
With the requested amount of KES 50,000, Nadzuwa will buy more stock of wheat flour, sacks of rice, cooking oil, and other fast-selling products.

loans.use: to buy more stock of wheat flour, sacks of rice, cooking oil, and other fast-selling products.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en: Due to financial difficulty, Shirley wants to improve her business to earn sufficient income and satisfy her family's needs. She is now 40 years old, married, and has three school-age children. She and her husband want to educate their children so that they will find a good job someday. Despite the hardship of living, they have the determination to achieve their goals someday. Shirley planned to raise more pigs to sell but due to insufficient capital, she is asking for an additional of PHP 40,000 to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccines, and piglets to raise. Through patience and hard work, she believes that her business will grow and become viable in the future.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccines, and piglets to raise.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 35 years old, married to Risper, and blessed with three children aged eight, seven, and four years, respectively. He provides transport services through his motorbike, a business he started 10 years ago. He earns a monthly income of KES 15,000. 

He wants to purchase another motorbike and has requested a second loan of KES 88,000.The profit he makes from his businesses will help him pay school fees for his children. His dream is to see his business expand and to educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase another motorbike for expansion of his business.

loans.name: Zonia

texts.es:
Zonia tiene 41 años, es una mujer trabajadora y con muchas ganas de progresar. Está separada del padre de sus hijos, por lo que ahora solo vive con ellos, de 23 y 21 años, y una persona a quien le alquila una habitación.
Su actividad es la crianza de pollos y la guardianía de la casa donde vive, allí implemente una pequeña granja con capacidad para 400 pollos, los cuales cría y luego vende. También tiene una refrigeradora que usa para la venta de gaseosas, como un ingreso adicional. Lleva realizando estos negocios desde hace 3 años y decidió empezar por la idea que le dio una de sus vecinas, pues antes tenía problemas económicos. Ahora, con sus negocios en marcha, tiene muchas ganas de seguir creciendo, reinvirtiendo sus ganancias, buscando ampliar su galpón donde pueda criar un mayor número de pollos.

Este es su préstamo número 9 con la institución MFP y está a gusto con su banco comunal, pues conoce a la mayoría de sus integrantes y los considera ser personas responsables y solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado, de 1500 nuevos soles, invertirá en compra de 150 pollos bebé, eso le costará 280 soles. Con el resto comprará bebederos y comederos para pollos, así como  alimento balanceado, en mayor volumen.
texts.en:
Zonia is 41 years old. She is a hard-working woman with a lot of desire to move forward. She is separated from the father of her children, so now she only lives with them, 21 and 23 years old, and a person to whom she rents a room.

She raises chickens and watches over the house where she lives. There she put in a small farm with capacity for 400 chickens, which she raises and then sells. She also has a refrigerator that she uses to sell soft drinks as an additional source of income. She has had these businesses for three years, and she decided to start because of the idea that one of her neighbors gave her, since she had financial problems before. Now, with her businesses up and running, she has a lot of desire to continue growing, reinvesting her earnings, and looking to expand her chicken barn, where she can raise more chickens.

This is her ninth loan with MFP, and she is happy with her communal bank, since she knows most of its members and considers them to be responsible and supportive people.

With the amount requested, 1500 nuevos soles, she will buy 150 baby chicks, which will cost her 280 soles. With the rest, she will buy chicken feeders and waterers, as well as balanced feed in greater volume.

loans.use: to purchase 150 baby chicks, waterers and feeders for chickens, and balanced feed

loans.name: Isaura Suyen

texts.es:
Isaura, continúa con sus ventas,  de ropa y ahora la venta de productos de celulares en cargadores, carcasa, cartuchera, batería, protectores, con el fin de obtener mejores utilidades para el apoyo familiar, sus dos pequeños hijos cursan la primaria, su esposo trabaja como contador en una empresa privada, teniendo el respaldo moral y económico.
Con este nuevo préstamo, comprara: baterías de varias marcas, cargadores, carcasas, cordones para celulares, así como ropa para seguir manteniendo sus ventas y la captación de clientes. Para poder apoyar con los gastos básicos y gastos personales, también ha logrado esta nueva inversión gracias a estos financiamientos otorgados en Afodenic.
texts.en:
Isaura continues with clothing sales and now with accessories for mobile phones like chargers, cases, cartridge belts, batteries, protector in order to obtain higher profits to support her family.  Her two small children attend elementary school and her husband works as an accountant in a private firm providing economic and moral support.

She will use this new loan to buy batteries of various brands, chargers, cases and cords for mobile phones as well as clothes to continue maintain her sales and acquiring clientele to be able to cover basic and personal expenses; she’s also been able to make this new investment thanks to Afodenic loans.

loans.use: to buy mobile phone accessories and clothes.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María tiene 48 años, es una mujer trabajadora y decidida, además de ser amable y cordial. Está casada con Hilter, el padre de sus tres hijos. 
Su actividad es la venta de gaseosas de diversos sabores y marcas, para esto cuenta con una refrigeradora que compró con sus ahorros, donde guarda a temperatura helada sus bebidas. Se inició con un préstamo de MFP hace más de un año y le gusta su negocio, pues le permite estar en casa y cuidar a sus pequeños hijos a los que quiere mucho, además de contar con los ingresos económicos para pagar los gastos de su hogar. Por otro lado, lo que no le gusta es cuando llueve muy seguido, ya que bajan sus ventas, pues ella depende mucho del clima, ya que su zona es de clima caluroso.

Este es su préstamo número 4 con la institución MFP y se siente cómoda con su banco comunal, pues los considera personas responsables y solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado, de 1500 nuevos soles, invertirá todo en la compra de más gaseosas para tener un stock disponible, buscando los precios más bajos por sus compras al contado y en volumen.
texts.en:
María, 48, is a hardworking, determined woman in addition to being nice and kind.  She’s married to Hilter, the father of her three children.

Her activity is selling soft-drinks in assorted flavors and brands.  To do so she has a refrigerator she bought with her savings where she keeps her drinks cold.  She started out with an MFP loan over a year ago and she likes her business because it allows her to stay at home and take care of her little ones who she loves very much while earning income needed to pay household expenses.  On the other hand, what she does not like is when it rains often because her sales drop since she’s very weather-dependent since she lives in a hot climate zone.

This is MFP loan #4 for her.  She’s comfortable in her communal bank because she considers the people to be responsible and mutually supportive.  She will use the entire requested 1500 new soles to buy more soft drinks to have stock available; she will look for the lowest prices available for cash high volume sales.

loans.use: to buy more soft-drinks.

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.en:
A beautiful woman by the name of Gulchehra lives in a house which is in bad condition. Her husband is a kind man who works in farming land and has a very small income. They have 4 clever children, 3 sons and one daughter.  Gulchehra’s children want to live in a house which is in good condition but her income from animal husbandry is not enough for it. She must build a new house. She is asking for a loan of 5000 TJS to buy building materials such as brick for building a new house. 
In this way she will be able to offer her family a better quality of life and moral stability that will allow them to progress. Each month she will make her payment on time. She awaits your support and mercy. Please, help her and her family if it is possible.

loans.use: to buy bricks for building her new house.

loans.name: Soeurng's Group

texts.en: Soeurng, 59, is a widow and mother of five children. She lives in a rural village of Sa Ang district of Kandal province, Cambodia. As a single mother, she has struggled to make a living through her small income as a worker in a local area. Having been in this business for several years, she can earn about KHR 10,000 per day for her daily expenses. Soeurng’s group consists of three members who live in the same village. She received the first loan with VisionFund one cycle ago and completely paid back the past loan, which has helped her relieve family’s burden. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Soeurng will use her portion to buy a latrine slab and necessary materials for constructing an above-ground shelter (bricks, cement, clay tile roof, sand). She hopes to improve the hygiene of her family.

loans.use: to construct a decent toilet.

loans.name: Shandy Rocio

texts.es:
La socia es la señorita Roció sigue perteneciendo al banco comunal “RICCHARY CUSCO; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia tiene 19 años y es soltera, Su actividad económica de la socia es la venta de granos secos como por ejemplo maíz, cebada, trigo y otras más. Ya son cuatro años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su negocio. Además, ella es una mujer emprendedora y responsable que estudia en sus horas libre la carrera de enfermería. En esta oportunidad Roció requiere el préstamo para invertir en el negocio de venta de granos secos y va comprar como por ejemplo maíz y trigo. 
   
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
La socia es la señorita Roció sigue perteneciendo al banco comunal “RICCHARY CUSCO; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

Rocío belongs to the “Ricchary Cusco” communal bank located in Huanchac District in Cusco Province and Department.  She’s 19-years-old, single and her economic activity is selling dry grains like corn, barley, wheat and others.  She’s been in this line of work for four years now and does very well thanks to the effort she puts into it.  In addition, she’s a very enterprising, responsible woman who is studying nursing in her free time.  

On this occasion, Rocío needs the loan to invest in her grains business; she will buy corn and wheat, for example.  She is grateful for the loan and commits to make her installment payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy corn and wheat.

loans.name: Caminando Con Jesus Group

texts.es: Doña Raimunda es miembro del Banco Comunal Caminando con Jesús, tiene 63 años de edad, es casada y madre de cinco hijos, su esposo trabaja en la agricultura, ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotería y reside en la ciudad de Juticalpa. Desde hace 4 años atrás doña Raimunda tiene una pulpería, y esta abierta al publico desde las 6:00 am hasta las 6:00 pm, trabaja en conjunto con una empleada que le ayuda atender la clientela cuando ella tiene que salir a comprar la mercadería para suministrar la pulpería también le ayuda por las mañanas ya que doña Raimunda trabaja de aseadora en una institución del gobierno. El préstamo que solicita doña Raimunda lo necesita para la compra de arroz, frijoles, manteca, jabón, aceite, pastas, salsas, condimentos, churros, refrescos, pan, carnes, embutidos, pollo, entre otros productos de consumo alimenticio. Con el apoyo de este préstamo ella podrá surtir su negocio y su clientela no se ira a otro lugar a comprar porque tendrá de todo un poquito en productos. Su sueño es hacer su negocio de bloque ya que actualmente es de madera y apoyar a sus hijos para que puedan terminar sus estudios académicos. Doña Raimunda tiene varios ciclos en FAMA y ha sido una clienta puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Raimunda is a member of the “Caminando con Jesús” (Walking with Jesus) communal bank.  She’s 63-years-old, married and the mother of five children.  Her husband works in agriculture and she sells groceries.  She lives in the city of Juticalpa.

Raimunda has had a grocery store for the last four years.  It’s open to the public from 6am until 6pm.  She works alongside an employee that helps her take care of customers whenever she needs to go out to buy merchandise to stock the grocery store.  She also helps her out during the morning when Raimunda works as a cleaning lady at a government institution.

Raimunda needs the loan to buy rice, beans, lard, soap, oil, pasta, sauces, condiments, snacks, soft-drinks, bread, meat, cured meats and chicken among other food items.  With support from this loan she will be able to stock her store and her customers won’t go elsewhere to buy because she’ll have a little of everything.  Her dream is to build her store out of concrete blocks since it’s currently wood and to support her children so that they can finish their academic studies.  Raimunda has been in several FAMA cycles and has made her payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Martina De Jesús

texts.es: Martina de Jesús de cuarenta y tres años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos, ella se dedica a la crianza de ganado y al cultivo de granos básicos, maíz y frijol, tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura y eso le ha dado la suficiente experiencia para poder obtener siempre las mejores cosechas, el terreno donde cultiva es muy adecuado para la siembra y se encuentra cercano a su vivienda, comercia en todas las zonas aledañas y se ha hecho de clientela muy valiosa, las personas saben que todo lo que comercia es de excelente calidad y todo a precios accesibles además de un servicio único siempre buscando la felicidad del cliente; Martina es una mujer decidida, trabajadora y con mucha valentía, esta dispuesta a esforzarse por alcanzar un futuro con éxito, en esta época de siembra buscara aumentar la producción pero no posee de suficiente capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar insumos , ganado, semilla de maíz, frijol, herbicida, abonos etc. Martina de Jesús es muy responsable y con buenas referencias de pago, asegura que podrá pagar la deuda y a la vez ofrecerle a su familia seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Martina de Jesús, 43, lives with her life companion and their children.  She works raising cattle and growing basic grains, corn and beans.  She’s been working in agriculture for several years and she’s gotten enough experience to be able to always obtain the best harvests.  The field she farms is very appropriate for planting and it’s located near her house.  She sells in all the neighboring areas and has acquired a very valuable clientele.  People know that everything she sells is excellent quality and prices are affordable.  Besides, service is unique and she always seeks to make her customers happy.

Martina is a very dedicated, hardworking, very courageous woman.  She’s willing to make the effort to reach a successful future.  In this planting season she wants to increase production but does not have enough capital to do so which is why she’s asking INTEGRAL for a loan to buy supplies, livestock, corn and bean seeds, herbicide, manure, etc.  Martina de Jesús is very responsible and has good payment references.  She’s sure she will be able to repay the loan while providing her family with economic security at the same time.

loans.use: to buy livestock, seeds and farm supplies.

loans.name: Ginalyn

texts.en:
Ginalyn is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Ginalyn is making and selling tocino in their village. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients for making tocino, like fresh meat and spices.

Ginalyn is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making tocino (sweetened cured pork, similar to bacon).

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana tiene 34 años, es una mujer emprendedora, alegre y muy amble. Está separada del padre de sus hijos, es por eso que ahora solo vive con ellos: Anthony de 19 años, Jesi de 14 años y Rosita de 10 años, a quienes quiere mucho y son su motivación para continuar trabajando.

Su actividad es la venta de comestibles, como arroz, azúcar, aceite y abarrotes en general que envía a los caseríos en las riveras de los ríos y zonas alejadas de la ciudad, donde tiene un  hermano quien vive en esa zona, él recibe la mercadería y la vende a los pobladores del lugar, son socios en este negocio. Esto lo hace 2 años atrás, pero también se dedica a la venta de comida, por las noches, en el frontis de su casa, y en las mañanas trabaja como empleada domestica. Considera que sus negocios son rentables por los ingresos económicos que le generan, con los cuales puede pagar los gastos de su hogar y la educación de sus hijos. Ahora, viendo los buenos resultados quiere aumentar el volumen de su mercadería para mejorar sus ingresos.

Este es su segundo préstamo con la institución MFP, por lo que se siente agradecida por la oportunidad de crédito. Además de estar cómoda con su banco comunal, pues los considera personas responsables y solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado, de 1000 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de mercadería variada, como arroz, azúcar, comestibles, combustible y otros para enviar por río a su hermano.
texts.en:
Juana, 34, is an enterprising, cheerful and very pleasant woman.  She’s separated from her children’s father which is why she now lives alone with them.  Anthony is 19, Jesi is 14 and Rosita is 10.  She loves them very much and they are the motivating force that keeps her working.

Her activity is selling foodstuffs like rice, sugar, oil and groceries in general that she sends to settlements on river banks and in areas far from the city where she has a brother living in that zone.  He receives the merchandise and sells it to residents in the area.  She and her brother are partners in this business.  She’s been doing this for the past two years but she also sells prepared food in the evening in front of her house and during the morning works as a domestic employee.  She considers her businesses to be profitable because of the income they generate that she can use to pay household expenses and for her children’s schooling.  Now, noting the good results she’s been having she wants to increase the volume of merchandise in order to improve income.

This is her second MFP loan. She’s grateful for the opportunity to have credit.  Also, she’s comfortable in her communal bank because she considers the people to be responsible and mutually supportive.

She will use the requested 1000 new soles to buy assorted merchandise like rice, sugar, food items, fuel and others to send by river to her brother.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es:
Gladis tiene 49 años, es una mujer trabajadora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Está casada con Alejandro, quien se dedica al transporte y es el padre de sus hijas.
Ella se dedica a la venta de comidas regionales, como “juanes” (arroz envuelto en hojas), “patarashca” (pescado envuelto en hojas), además de pollo frito, arroz chaufa y otros. Todas las noches se instala en el frontis de su casa, donde pone sus mesitas, sillas y una carpa. Allí atiende, muy amablemente, a sus clientes, viene realizando esta actividad hace más de 10 años y ha logrado hacerse conocida y solicitada por la buena sazón que tiene, además cuenta con la ayuda de pareja e hijas en ciertas ocasiones. Está contenta con su actividad, ya que puede estar toda la mañana con sus hijos; comenta que antes el dinero que ganaba su esposo no les alcanzaba para solventar todos los gastos de su hogar, por eso ahora, viendo los buenos resultados, tiene planeado construir un local para la venta de sus comidas.

Este es su préstamo número 13 con la institución MFP y está siempre agradecida por la confianza que ponen en ella, además de estar a gusto con su banco comunal, pues lo considera un grupo unido y de personas responsables.
Con el monto solicitado, de 1000 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de los ingredientes para la preparación de sus comidas, como arroz, azuzar, aceites y otros. También algunos utensilios de cocina (cucharas, platos, tasas y demás).
texts.en:
Gladis, 49, is a hardworking woman who very much wants to get ahead.  She’s married to Alejandro who works in transportation and is the father of their daughters.  

She works selling regional dishes like “juanes” (rice wrapped in leaves), “patarashca” (fish wrapped in leaves), fried chicken, Chinese-style fried rice and others.  She sets up tables, chairs and a tent every evening in her front yard.  She tends to her customers there very kindly.  

She’s been in this business more than ten years and has become very well-known and sought-after because of the tasty way she cooks.  Her spouse and daughters help her on certain occasions.  

She’s happy with her activity because she can spend all morning with her spouse and children.  She comments that the money her husband earned before wasn’t enough to cover all household expenses which is why now, seeing her good results, she plans to build a locale in which to sell her food.

This is MFP loan #13.  She’s always grateful for the trust placed in her and she’s comfortable in her communal bank because she considers it to be a united group of responsible people.  She will use the requested 1000 new soles to buy ingredients like rice, sugar, oil and others, to prepare her meals and also some kitchen utensils (spoons, dishes, cups and others).

loans.use: to buy ingredients and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: Santos de cincuenta y cuatro años de edad vive junto a su familia, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y además a la venta de ganado bobino y cerdo, tiene ya muchos años de trabajar en el rubro por lo que ha ganado suficiente experiencia que le permite obtener siempre las mejores cosechas y obtener la mejor venta con su ganado, el terreno donde cultiva es muy adecuado para la siembra, comercia en todas las zonas aledañas y ya tiene mucha clientela que la prefiere porque siempre su producto es de primera calidad y a precios accesibles pero sobre todo con un excelente servicio; Santos es un hombre trabajador, muy conocido en su comunidad, se caracteriza por su responsabilidad y por su motivación por salir adelante, su mas grande secreto es la constancia y el amor a su labor esta seguro que solo así alcanzara el triunfo; en la temporada pasada obtuvo perdidas de la cosecha y en esta época de siembra desea recuperarse pero no del suficiente capital para la compra de insumos por eso se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, herbicidas, insecticida, abono entre otros. Santos tiene buenas referencias de pago por lo que asegura que podrá cancelar la deuda en el periodo establecido y a la vez ofrecerle a su familia la calidad de vida que se merecen.
texts.en: Santos is fifty-four years old and lives together with his family. He grows corn for a living, in addition to selling cattle and pigs. He has been working on this for a lot of years now, so he has gained enough experience that allows him to always get the best harvests and get the best sale of his cattle. The land he cultivates is very adequate for the sowing. He sells in all the nearby areas and has a lot of customers that prefer to buy from him because his product is always of high quality, at affordable prices and he provides an excellent service. Santos is a hard-working man, very well known in his community, he is noted for his responsibility and his drive to get ahead. His biggest secret is his perseverance and the love he feels for the work he does. He is sure that is the only way to achieve success. Last season he got losses from the harvest and this season he wants to recover but he doesn't have enough capital to buy supplies, reason why he decided to request Integral for a loan that will allow him to buy corn seeds, herbicides, insecticides and fertilizers, among others. Santos has good payment references, which is why he assures he will be able to repay the loan in the established period, while at the same time offering his family the quality of life they deserve.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, herbicides, insecticides and fertilizers

loans.name: Elavagnon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe ELAVAGNON est composé de quatre personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Zénabou est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Zénabou est âgée de 40 ans et ne vit plus avec son mari. Zénabou n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Zénabou a deux enfants, dont un scolarisé et à sa charge. Zénabou vit seule avec son enfant à charge et assure seule les différentes charges de la maison. Pour contribuer aux différents besoins de la famille, Zénabou vend depuis vingt ans des vêtements et des chaussures à son domicile et par le système de distribution. Cette activité lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté à ses besoins. Zénabou s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Zénabou sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe ELAVAGNON, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le premier  prêt a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The Elavagnon group has four members, who all live in the same neighborhood. This is the second time that this group has requested financial assistance from Alidé, and they have done so to increase their business levels.

The group is represented by Zénabou, who is pictured with her hand raised in the photo. She is 40 years of age, and no longer lives with her husband. She did not attend school, and has two children, one of whom is at school and is under her care. 

Zénabou lives alone with her child, and is solely responsible for the various household expenses. To contribute to meeting her family’s different needs, she has worked for 20 years selling clothing and shoes from home and through the distribution system. This business allows her to provide for herself without any great difficulty. 

Zénabou gets her supplies from a market in Benin. In order to satisfy her customers and increase her sales and income, she has requested a second loan from Alidé, along with the other members of the Elavagnon group. Their first loan was successfully repaid.

loans.use: To buy clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita believes that "hardships and difficulties are not hindrances to success." She is 54 years old and has 10 grown-up children. Rosita has been engaged in a hog-raising business for almost 11 years. She usually earns a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, which she spends on food, clothing and allowance for her youngest child, who is still studying.

Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, Rosita needs to improve her business to earn sufficient income. She is therefore requesting additional capital of PHP 30,000 to buy more piglets to raise and necessary feed and vitamins for hog-raising. Rosita hopes that someday her business will grow and become a viable source of income.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets, pig feed and vitamins

loans.name: Samvel

texts.en: Samvel started a little restaurant business 5 months ago and he now needs some investments to develop the restaurant. This loan will help Samvel to purchase an oven, a freezer, food, vegetables and meat. It is important for Samvel to maintain a stable development of his business and to have sufficient income to invest in its expansion.

loans.use: to purchase an oven, a freezer, food, vegetables and meat

loans.name: Rogelia

texts.en: Rogelia, 53 years old, lives in Naga, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has no children. Rogelia has a hog fattening and firewood vending business, earning approximately PHP 3,000 each month. She has requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to purchase additional firewood to sell and feed for her pigs. Rogelia has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, she hopes to engage in another type of business.

loans.use: To purchase additional firewood to sell and feed for her pigs

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia, 58 years old, is married and has 3 children. She has been raising pigs for 5 years and also earns additional income from her general store. Virginia is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She works tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Elmira

texts.en:
Elmira is a 28-year-old hardworking woman with a great desire to get ahead. She is a divorcee with 2 children, 3 and 6 years old, whom she loves very much. They live together in a small house.

Elmira sells a variety of agricultural products, such as watermelon, in the center of her town. She makes periodic trips to accomplish her goal. Elmira began working this way over 2 years ago because she needed to earn money. As a result of the good results she is having, she wishes to increase her business further by selling more watermelon. Elmira is asking for a loan of 10,000 TJS to buy goods for her developing business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy more watermelon

loans.name: Alberto

texts.en:
Alberto is a shopkeeper in Mexico City. He has a degree in physical education, which he continues to use, but he became a shopkeeper in order to increase his income. Alberto enjoys working in the store because he likes interacting with people all day long. 

Until recently, Alberto kept track of all of his sales and purchases in small notebook, an “accounting system” that provided no way of tracking even basic information such as the profitability of the store or what the best product was.
 
Now that Alberto has Tiendatek, he is moving forward with bigger plans for the business: transforming it into a full-fledged supermarket and convenience store. To achieve this goal, Alberto knows he will need to hire at least one employee, but he wants to make sure he has better control over the shop beforehand and this was the main reason he purchased Tiendatek. Through real-time information about inventory and profitability, Alberto hopes to be able to reach his supermarket goal "little by little" and thus continue to support the education of his three daughters.

loans.use: to pay for a Tiendatek device to better manage his store through inventory control and performance reports

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en: Antonieta, 58 years old,  is a widow with 3 children. For the past 3 years, she has managed a banana and coconut farm, earning a monthly income of PHP 4,000. Antonieta has requested a loan of PHP 6,000 to purchase fertilizer. She has been a member of GDMPC since 2010. In the future, Antonieta hopes for her children to finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Assia

texts.en: Assia, a married mother, is a native of the town of Kwale, Kenya. She is grateful for her first KIVA loan, which was of great benefit to her since she invested it in the purchase of fish to sell. Her customers have been very satisfied with the quality of service she offers and demand for her product has grown a bit. Consequently she sees the need for more investment and is requesting a second loan in order to buy more fish and cooking oil. Assia wants to expand her business and open a kiosk in the future. Her principal priority is to obtain enough income to pay for her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy more fish and cooking oil.

loans.name: Wilen

texts.en: Wilen, 40 years old, is married and has 4 children, 3 of them in school.. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Wilen has operated a fishing business in the Philippines for 17 years. She has requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy raw materials for fishing. In the future, Wilen would like to save enough money to build a new house for her family.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for fishing.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, Erlinda works hard to support her family.

She has a fruit business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from dried fish.  Erlinda is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of fruit to sell.  Erlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruit to sell.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.es:
Ofelia tiene 57 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora. Su pareja es Teófilo, quien es técnico en enfermería y el padre de sus tres hijas. Juntos (además de sus tres nietos) viven en su casa propia, la cual compraron a base de muchos años de trabajo.
Ella se dedica a la venta de comestibles en una mesa que instala en el frontis de su vivienda. Inició este negocio (hace 10 años) debido a la necesidad económica que atravesaba, y poco a poco empezó a crecer, contando con el apoyo de su pareja. Le gusta su actividad porque le permite estar en su casa y cuidar a sus hijos y nietos. Por otro lado, lo que no le gusta es cuando no pudo vender todos sus productos y se malogran, ocasionándole algunas pérdidas, pero eso no la desanima y realiza mejor los cálculos de sus ventas para comprar lo necesario y evitar que se descomponga.

Este es su prestando número 11 con la institución MFP y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero para concretar sus planes. Por otro lado, está cómoda con su banco comunal, pues lo considera un grupo unido y solidario.
Con el monto solicitado, de 1500 nuevos soles, invertirá en compra de plátanos, verduras y comestibles, como arroz, huevos, aceites y otros, a precio por mayor.
texts.en:
Ofelia is 57 years old and is a very friendly and hardworking woman. Her partner is Teófilo, who is a nurse technician and the father of her three daughters. They all live, together with their three grandchildren, in their own house which they bought as the product of many years of hard work

She earns her living selling food products from a table which she sets up in front of her home. She started this business 10 years ago due to financial necessity, and slowly it grew with the support of her partner. She likes this work because it allows her to stay at home and look after her children and grandchildren. On the other hand, she does not like it when she can't sell all of her products and they go to waste causing her some loss. However this does not discourage her and she improved her sales calculations to buy what is necessary and avoid food going bad.

This is her loan number 11 with the MFP institute and he feels grateful for the financial support which allows her to put her plans into action. 

She is happy with her communal bank because she considers it to be a united and supportive group. With the amount she is asking for of 1500 nuevos soles she will buy plantains, vegetable and other foods such as rice, eggs and oils at wholesale prices.

loans.use: to buy plantains, vegetable and other foods such as rice, eggs and oils.

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en: Lanie, 44 years old, is married and has three children. She lives in the Philippines. For the past 5 years, Lanie has been farming corn to earn a living. She has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase farm supplies. Lanie has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, she hopes to harvest more corn.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 29 years old, married, and has four children.  To earn a living, she does pig farming.  She has been in the business for three years.  She also owns a bar where she earns extra income.  Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has grown her business because she has been trained in business management skills.
Caroline hopes to expand her business and employ more people.  She needs a loan of 40,000 KES to buy pig feed and a pig.

loans.use: To buy pig feed and a pig

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.  Helen requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment. She has been in this business for 15 years.  In the future, Helen would like to save enough to build a new house.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Nea's Group

texts.en: Nea is 37 years old and is a married mother living in a rural village of the Sa Ang district of Kanda province, Cambodia. She has been working as a paid worker while her husband works as a construction laborer in a local area. Having been in this business for 17 years, they are able to earn about 10,000 KHR per day and can manage to save about 4,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. She has been with VisionFund for four cycles and completely paid back the loans, while the other members have been with VisionFund for less than one cycle. The past loans have helped her family with sufficient food. Now leading her group of three to request a loan, Nea will use her loan portion to construct a proper toilet for her family. She hopes to own a proper toilet to promote good health conditions among her family members.

loans.use: To construct a proper toilet for her family

loans.name: Salem

texts.en:
Salem is a hardworking entrepreneur who has operated a ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines for 4 years. She earns additional income from selling frozen foods. Salem is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of ready-to-wear clothing to sell.

Salem has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ready-to-wear clothing

loans.name: Emilie

texts.en: Emilie is married and she works hard to support her family. She has operated a bamboo retail business in the Philippines for 11 years, and earns additional income from fish vending. Emilie has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of bamboo to sell to her customers. In the future, Emilie would like to save enough to build a new house for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bamboo to sell

loans.name: German Enrique

texts.es:
German Enrique tiene 34 años, Es casado vive con los suegros, la esposa y los hijos, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. LUCHANDO POR UNA MISMA CAUSA, se encuentra ubicada en el en el Recinto La primavera, perteneciente al Canton Ventans, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz.

German se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz  y frejol. Las compras lo hace en Ventanas. Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de insumos, urea, insecticidas y fertilizantes para los cultivos.  

Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. El sueño es construir una casa mas grande por la familia necesita estar mas comoda.

Le gusta hacer deporte en especial futbool.
texts.en:
German Enrique, 34, lives with his wife, children and in-laws in the Ecuadorean canton of Ventanas.

The LUCHANDO POR UNA MISMA CAUSA community bank is in Recinto La Primavera, a rural town in Ventanas.  The members operate farming businesses, growing maize and rice.

German grows maize, rice and beans.  He buys what he needs in Ventanas.  He is applying for a loan that he will use to buy supplies--urea, insecticides, fertilizers, etc.--for his next maize and rice crop.

The investment will provide the support he needs to earn a decent living.  For the future, he wants to build a more comfortable house for his family.

German likes sports and, most especially, football.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his farming business.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en: Jovelyn, 38 years old, is single. She lives in Pag-asa, Dumalinao ZDS. Jovelyn has operated a store for 6 years, selling rice and many more items. She earns a monthly income of PHP 16,000. Jovelyn has requested a loan of PHP 11,000 to purchase more stock of rice for her retail store. She has been a member of PMPC for 10 months. In the future, Jovelyn hopes to expand her business in her town.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of rice for her store

loans.name: Zulfiyya

texts.en:
Zulfiyya is a very enthusiastic and hardworking 38 year-old single woman.  She is a market vendor and sells goods such as gifts and office supplies. She has 3 years of experience in this field. After graduating from university, Zulfiyya couldn`t find a job. With the help of AqroInvest loans she was able to start her own business. Now it brings her a stable income of 110 AZN, and her mother helps her. 

She is very polite and friendly with customers which makes her business successful. However, her profit is not enough for her well being  and she would like to increase the range of goods in her shop. For this purpose, she applied for 1500 AZN.  She has a good client history and this will be her second loan.

loans.use: to buy more goods

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita is 33 years old and has eight children. Anita is married and has three children who are in school. Anita is in the agricultural business raising hogs in the Philippines. Anita requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Anita has been hog raising for 2 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Anita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Deria

texts.en: Deria is 45 years old, married, and has 7 children.  Deria is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Deria requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Deria has been raising pigs for 3 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Deria would like to save enough to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Enith

texts.es:
Enith tiene 49 años, es una mujer trabajadora empeñosa y decidida. Está separada del padre de sus dos hijas, por ello ahora solo viven con ellas, en su casa propia, la cual compraron con mucho esfuerzo.
Su actividad es la venta de ropa, toda su mercadería la compra su hermana en la ciudad capital y luego se la envía a Enith para venderla desde su casa a sus vecinos y familiares, muchas veces al crédito a 30 días y otras pocas al contado. Realiza este negocio desde hace 3 años, en sociedad con su hija, quien ha logrado alquilar un puesto en una galería comercial donde ella (su hija) atiende. La idea de este negocio, justamente fue de su hija, y ahora viendo los buenos resultados Enith tiene planes de comprar una máquina de coser para confeccionar algunas prendas de vestir para venderlas junto con su mercadería.

Este es su quinto préstamo con la institución MFP, por ello espera concretar sus planes. Además de sentirse bien con su banco comunal, pues lo considera un grupo unido y solidario.
Con el monto solicitado, de 1500 nuevos soles, invertirá todo en la compra de más ropa de toda variedad, dinero que le enviará a su hermana en la capital.
texts.en:
Enith, 49, is a tenacious, hard-working woman.  She is separated from the father of her children.  She lives with her children, two daughters, in a house that she was only able to buy after much hard work.
Enith operates a clothing sales business.  Her sister buys clothing in the capital and sends it to her.  She sells, from her house, to family and neighbors, sometimes for cash and sometimes on 30-day terms.  She started the business with her daughter 3 years ago and she (her daughter) subsequently rented a space that she (her daughter) operates at a local shopping center.  Enith's daughter had the original idea for the business, but she (Enith) plans to buy a sewing machine to make clothes that she can sell along with her other merchandise.  

This is her fifth MFP loan and she will use it to carry out her plan.  She says that she likes her community bank and that its members are united and supportive.
Enith will use this 1500 new soles loan to stock her clothing business with clothing that her sister will send from the capital.

loans.use: to stock her clothing sales business.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en: Mary Ann is married and she works hard to support her family. She has operated a fishing business in the Philippines for 21 years. Mary Ann has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy a net and other fishing equipment. In the future, Mary Ann would like to save enough to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy a net and other fishing equipment

loans.name: Maria Jesusa

texts.en:
Maria Jesusa is a 32-year-old retail store owner in Padul. She is married and has four children attending school. Maria Jesusa runs her store from 6:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m, earning PHP 300 daily for meals and her children's allowances. She is looking for business expansion so is asking for a loan of PHP 13,000 to buy soft drinks, eggs, breads, coffee and sugar to sell in her store. 

Additional merchandise will help Maria Jesusa to increase sales capacity and gain more income. She is a very determined, kind-hearted person and will be happy to send all her children to school. Maria Jesusa promises to pay back her loan in full.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, eggs, breads, coffee and sugar to sell in her store

loans.name: Armando  Antonio

texts.es: Armando  Antonio de treinta y ocho años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus cuatro hijos en casa propia desde hace diecisiete años; él se dedica al cultivo de cereales especialmente frijol y maíz, tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar en la agricultura y se siente orgulloso porque ha ganado experiencia valiosa que le permite obtener buenas cosechas, el terreno donde cultiva es arrendado y esta bien ubicado en una zona apta para la siembra, comercia en todas las zonas cercanas a la comunidad y tiene mucha clientela pues las personas lo buscan porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan con producto de calidad y a precios accesibles además de un servicio inigualable; Armando es un hombre muy trabajador, honesto pero sobre todo con muchas ganas de salir adelante, siempre esta a la expectativa de nuevas oportunidades que le abran camino al éxito, en esta época de siembra quiere aumentar la producción pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, frijol, insecticida, herbicida, abono, herramienta, etc. Armando Antonio tiene buenas referencias crediticias esta seguro que podrá cancelar  la deuda y al mismo tiempo podrá ofrecerle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en: Armando Antonio, 38, lives with his wife and four children in a house that he has owned for 17 years.  He operates a farming business, growing beans and maize.  He has been a farmer for many years and says that he has learned what it takes to bring in good harvests.  The land that he rents is well situated for crops.  He sells in local markets and has many customers.  They seek him out because they know that he can deliver a good product at a reasonable price.  Armando is an honest, hard-working man with a strong drive to get ahead.  He's always looking for new opportunities that can lead to new successes.  He wants to increase his output and he's applying to INTEGRAL for a loan that he will use to buy the supplies--seeds, insecticides, herbicides, tools, etc.--that he needs to carry out his plans.  Armando Antonio has good references who are confident that he can repay the loan in the agreed-upon time.  The investment will provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his farming business.

loans.name: Adan

texts.es: Adán de cincuenta y ocho años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz, frijol, maicillo, tiene muchos años de trabajar en la agricultura y se ha hecho de mucha experiencia valiosa que le da la oportunidad de obtener siempre las mejores cosechas, el terreno de cultivo esta ubicado en una zona de alta incidencia agrícola y esta cercano a su vivienda, comercia en todas las zonas aledañas a la comunidad y ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas saben que todo lo que comercia es de primera calidad y a precios accesibles; Adán es un hombre emprendedor, muy dedicado a su labor siempre esta a la búsqueda de nuevas oportunidades que le permitan alcanzar el éxito, en la ultima temporada de siembra tubo perdidas debido al clima y en esta cosecha quiere recuperarse pero necesita capital para la inversión en insumos por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, frijol, maicillo, herbicida, insecticida, etc. Adán tiene buenas referencias de crédito y es muy responsable en sus pagos por eso asegura poder cancelar la deuda y a la vez llevar a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en: Adan, 58, lives with his wife and children.  He operates a farming business, growing maize, beans and maicillo.  He has been a farmer for many years and says that he has learned how to bring in a good harvest.  His land is well situated and close to his house.  He sells in local markets and says that he has many customers because they know that he can deliver a good product at a reasonable price.  Adan is an enterprising man, always looking for new opportunites to get ahead.  He incurred some weather-related losses last year and says that he wants to make up for the losses in the coming year.  He is applying for an INTEGRAL loan that he will use to buy the supplies--seeds, herbicides, insecticides, etc.--that he needs for his next crop.  Adan has good references who are confident that he can repay the loan in the agreed-upon time.  The investment will provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his farming business.

loans.name: Aynura

texts.en:
Aynura is a 37-year-old woman who raises and sells fruits and vegetables. She is a farmer and market vendor at the same time. She is married and has two children. She has 12 years of experience in raising crops. She usually sells them from her yard and from her shop. Her monthly income is 120 Azerbaijani New Manat (AZN).

Raising crops takes a lot of strength and requires physical work, which is hard for one woman; hence, her husband helps her to raise crops and take them to the shop. She raises cucumbers, tomatoes, pears, potatoes, carrots, apples, cherries and onions. 

She applied for a 1,500 AZN loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers to improve the quality of her land. This will be her second loan, and she has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is 59 years old, married and has 7 children. 

Margarita is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines.  She has been raising pigs for 5 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Margarita requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.  In the future, Margarita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Milagrina

texts.en:
Milagrina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a gown rentals business in the Philippines.   She has been in this business for 45 years, and also earns more income from raising livestock.   Milagrina is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy additional gowns for her customers.

Milagrina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: buys gowns to rent

loans.name: Lenie

texts.en:
Lenie is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 4 children.   

Lenie buys and sells fish in her community.  She has had this business for 6 years.  She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy a  variety of fish to resell.

Lenie is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy fish to sell

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is 50 years old, married and blessed with three children.  To earn a living, he sells electronic goods such as televisions and computers.  He has been in this business since 1998.  He has grown his business since he joined Faulu Kenya because he has been trained on business management skills.

Bernard has requested 60, 000 KES to buy more televisions and computers.

loans.use: buy TVs and computers to sell

loans.name: Manush

texts.en:
Manush lives in Ashotavan community with her husband, little son and parents-in-law. The family is involved in agriculture: they raise cows, sheep, pigs, chickens, cultivate wheat, potatoes and grow fruit trees. 

Manush has applied for this loan to expand their farm and improve its conditions. With the help of this loan she plans to purchase 10 sheep, seeds, fertilizer, forage for the cattle and fuel for the agricultural machine to cultivate the land. These purchases will allow Manush to develop cattle breeding and gather a good harvest, which will insure a stable income for her family during the year.

loans.use: buy sheep, forage, seeds, fertilizer and fuel

loans.name: Khanbaba

texts.en:
Khanbaba is a 50-year-old trader who sells products such as toothpaste, soap, washing powder and other detergents. He has 15 years of experience in this field.  He also raises seasonal fruits and vegetables, however this shop brings him a more stable income.  

Khanbaba is married and has four children.  His shop located in the central bazaar and his son helps him sell the goods. His monthly income is 200 AZN.  Khanbaba applied for a loan of 1500 AZN to purchase more goods and to diversify his products.

loans.use: buy goods to sell

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 40 years old, married and blessed with four children. He is a fish farmer in Tambach town and this has been his source of income for the last four years.  From this business he gets an average monthly income of KES 20,000. 

John has borrowed a third loan of KES.40,000 after successfully repaying the previous loans. With this loan, he intends to use the KES 35,000 to purchase animal feed and fencing materials.  The remaining amount will be used for transportation and other costs. He anticipates getting more profit,  which he will use to expand his business as well as save some amount for the future. 

John hopes to improve his living standards as well as expand his business.

loans.use: buy animal feed and fencing

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria used her previous loan amount to buy potato seeds and fertilizer for planting.  She was able to plant and it was profitable.  She was able to pay the loan well and in good time.  Apart from farming, she also has a cereals shop.

This is Maria's third loan and she plans to buy more stock of cereals to sell in her cereals shop.  These include beans, wheat and green grains as well as dry maize.  With the anticipated income, she plans to pay school fees for her children.

In the future, Maria hopes to buy a plot of land and build rental houses.

loans.use: buy cereals to sell

loans.name: Akua

texts.en: Akua sells second-hand clothing in Watreso, near Abura.  She has been selling second-hand clothing for fives years.  Akua received an education through middle school.  She has six children and is responsible for paying her children's school fees as well as other household expenses. Her loan will be used to buy clothing in bulk. She hopes to use her new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: buy clothing in bulk to sell

loans.name: Ai's Group

texts.en: Ai is 31 years old. She is married and resides with three children, two daughters and one son, all of whom are dependent on her and in school. Living in the Kandal province’s Sa Ang district of Cambodia, Ai and her husband make a living through working as a garment worker and construction laborer. They have been in this business for 4 years and can earn about KHR 10,000 per day from the current business to meet the family’s needs.
